results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 08
results.creator_credit: L.H. Hicks, Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel includes the following: 1. RAAF’s Lockheed Hercules transport. 2. Supersonic “dart” is practice target for fighters. 3. “Sarah” (search and rescue and homing) is a new radio device for sea rescues. 4. The RAAF Antarctic flight visits the Soviet base.

results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 02
results.creator_credit: Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: The following newsreel items are covered: The end in Korea - No. 77 Squadron fought till the last day; Thanks sister! - RAAF evacuates Korean wounded; Canberras for RAAF - Australia makes jet bomber; The air race - London to New Zealand - 24 hours; Williamtown is busy - school of land/air warfare; Off to the coronation - RAAF and WRAAF looked fine; Faster than sound - RAAF gets sonic jet fighter. Narrated by Douglas H. Moon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations

results.title: RAAF Base Butterworth
results.creator_credit: Harry Rayner and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: Life on the RAAF base at Butterworth, Malaya. British, Australian and Malayan personnel; relationships with the local people; provision for family life and recreation; the wives and children and airmen; servicing and flying aircraft; training exercises; practice with the one-man dinghy; the airmen as ambassadors.

results.title: R.A.A.F. Newsreel. No. 13. The Queen and the R.A.A.F
results.creator_credit: H Rayner and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Screen magazine: Commemorates the important part played by the R.A.A.F. during the visit of Her Majesty the Queen and His Royal Highness, the Duke of Edinburgh to Australia, February 1963. Providing air transport in an R.A.A.F. Convair; immaculate guards of honour; exhibitions of precise formation flying and performance by the R.A.A.F. Central Band.

results.title: Quilts in women's lives
results.creator_credit: Pat Ferrero and New Day Films
results.brief_description: A multi-award winning film on the traditional art of quiltmaking and its affect on the lives of seven women. Each from quite diverse backgrounds, the women discuss the influences that inspire quilt design, and how their lives and times are depicted in their work.
results.description: A multi-award winning film on the traditional art of quiltmaking and its affect on the lives of seven women. Each from quite diverse backgrounds, the women discuss the influences that inspire quilt design, and how their lives and times are depicted in their work.

results.title: Quill
results.creator_credit: Jo Kennedy and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: A woman’s desire to write is literally inscribed onto her body when her breasts begin to leak ink. Cast includes Sally Cooper, Belinda McCory.

results.title: Quiet crisis
results.brief_description: A dramatised story of a typical cancer case. This film is a plea for an early visit to the doctor by anyone having the slightest suspicion of the disease. Shows that with early treatment by improved methods, cancer may often be cured while delay can prove to be fatal. Note: This film had been viewed by medical experts and it is considered that the treatment portrayed in the film is not in accord with actual treatment as available in Victoria.

results.title: Quetico
results.creator_credit: Christopher Chapman and Canadian Film Institute
results.brief_description: Quetico Provincial Park in Ontario, an area of over a million acres of unspoiled wilderness, is being preserved as canoe country for present and future generations. The area is as wild and natural today as it was in the 17th century when explorer, trader and voyager passed through in search of furs and discovery.
